original_content:
Nice, visual simulators of CPUs such as the 6502 are usually made much later and with more modern tooling than what they simulate. But what if that wasnt the case? What if a simulator runs on the very hardware its simulating?
This is what [Tea Leaves] stumbled upon when he found a mysterious disk with only APL6502.SIM on it. [Tea Leaves] demonstrates the simulator with a basic 6502 assembly program, revealing an animated, beautiful Apple 2 simulator that actually runs on the Apple 2! The simulator shows all the major components of a 6502 and actually animates the complete data flow of an instruction.
But why is this mysterious? Its mysterious because  a hello program aside  its the only thing on the disk! Not so much as a single clue as to where it came from. [Tea Leaves] finds out where it comes from, including incorrectly copied disk images and a revelation at the end.
Video after the break.
title: Apple 2上で動く驚きの6502シミュレーターが発見される！
body: 「Tea Leaves」は、見つけたAPL6502.SIMという謎のディスクで、Apple 2上で実行される美しい6502シミュレータを見つけた。謎は、他に何もないディスクからどこから来たのかわからないことです。最後には、間違ってコピーされたディスクイメージなどが明らかになる。ビデオもあります。
titles: Apple 2上で動く驚きの6502シミュレーターが発見される！
APL6502.SIM: Apple 2で動く美しい6502シミュレーター
謎のディスクから発見された6502シミュレーターに迫る！
6502シミュレーターの謎を解く旅に出る
Apple 2で動く驚異的な6502シミュレーターの秘密を暴く！
